summary: This is an FAA aircraft registration statement for JEGE, LLC, a limited liability company organized in the US Virgin Islands. The document lists Jeffrey Epstein as a member and Lawrence Visoski as a manager, certifying the company's eligibility to register aircraft as a U.S. citizen entity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as an individual member of JEGE, LLC, a company registering an aircraft, with U.S. citizenship indicated.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.context: Listed as a manager of JEGE, LLC, the company registering an aircraft, with U.S. citizenship indicated.

connections.description: Both are listed as part of JEGE, LLC, with Epstein as a member and Visoski as a manager of the company registering an aircraft.

events.title: Formation of JEGE, LLC
events.description: JEGE, LLC was legally organized as a limited liability company in the United States Virgin Islands.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Filing
events.description: JEGE, LLC filed a statement with the FAA Aircraft Registration Branch in Oklahoma City to register an aircraft, certifying compliance with U.S. citizenship requirements.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as a member of JEGE, LLC, a company formed in the US Virgin Islands in October 2012.
Lawrence Visoski is identified as a manager of JEGE, LLC.
The document certifies that JEGE, LLC meets U.S. citizenship requirements for aircraft registration, with at least 75% of voting interest controlled by U.S. citizens.
The filing was submitted to the FAA Aircraft Registration Branch in Oklahoma City on November 10, 2013.
The document indicates Epstein's involvement in aviation assets through a corporate entity.
